  "Allegations" : "CLAIMANTS ARE OR WERE CLIENTS OF NEUBERGER BERMAN LLC (\"NEUBERGER\"). BETWEEN JANUARY 2005 AND DECEMBER 2007, CLAIMANTS INVESTED IN CERTAIN STRUCTURED NOTES ISSUED BY LEHMAN BROTHERS AND LEHMAN BROTHERS PRIVATE EQUITY FUNDS (COLLECTIVELY, THE \"SECURITIES\"). FOLLOWING LEHMAN BROTHERS' BANKRUPTCY, CLAIMANTS COMMENCED A FINRA ARBITRATION REGARDING THE SECURITIES AGAINST NEUBERGER AND CERTAIN CURRENT AND FORMER MEMBERS OF SENIOR MANAGEMENT, INCLUDING THE FIRM'S CEO, CFO, CIO AND CCO, ALLEGING VARIOUS THEORIES OF RECOVERY, INCLUDING BREACH OF FIDUCIARY DUTY, FRAUD AND VIOLATIONS OF VARIOUS STATE AND FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS.  WHILE MEMBERS OF SENIOR MANAGEMENT WERE NAMED AS RESPONDENTS, AT NO TIME DID THEY HAVE DIRECT RESPONSIBILITY FOR CLAIMANTS' ACCOUNTS.  NEUBERGER HAS FILED AN ANSWER DENYING THE SUBSTANCE OF THE MATERIAL ALLEGATIONS AND BELIEVES IT HAS MERITORIOUS DEFENSE TO ALL CLAIMS.",
